name: Bank Villa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our hosts Liz and Graham made us feel at home and like old friends form the moment we arrived. Our en-suite room was extremely comfortable without a tv which was a refreshing change. The lounge and conservatory looked comfortable and well furnished although we never used them in our stay and the hotel gardens were well kept.
reviews.title: Home from home

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our cooked breakfasts were first class and as good as we have had anywhere and the items on the menu were all locally sorurced.
reviews.title: Fantastic Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is great with local shops,restaurants and pubs all within 10 minutes walking ( or crawling ) distance with Ripon a 20 minute drive away.An especially nice little touch is the little welcome gift that is provided in your room upon arrival !!!
reviews.title: Friendly and warm with a big Yorkshire welcome!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you're after a hotel that makes you feel and relax like you're at home and thats in a relaxing and quiet location yet is no more than a few minutes drive to plenty of alternative things to do then this is the hotel for you !!
reviews.title: Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Wonderful hosts, friendly, helpful and very genorouse breakfast with lots of choice. We will certainly return and hopefully stay longer. The town and brewery's are worth a visit. Our aaccommodation had lots of little extra touches which were much appreciated. Two large lounges and conservatory so lots of space and beautiful gardens. A lovely place to return to.
reviews.title: Another lovely weekend in Masham

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Bank Villa should/could be so much more. First the positives, it's essentially a lovely house, the beds were large and comfortable, plenty of bedding, pillows, towels and hot water. Breakfast was very good.
reviews.title: Should have been better for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The ensuite shower room was really an extended "cupboard"; during the time we were there the radiator was luke warm, there were exactly 4 teabags provided, the usual plastic tubes of milk, bedside lamps with energy saving bulbs which took time "to warm up" and then didn't seem particularly bright, a 1980's cd/radio alarm and no TV.
reviews.title: The Perfect Place to Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: TV in the lounge was tired and dated, which unfortunately added to the overall dreary feel.
reviews.title: Could & should be so much better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Although there is nothing really wrong with it, at £52.50 pppn, it's expensive for what it is - a good boarding house at hotel prices and there is better value to be found. We were with a very large party, all staying in various much discussed establishments, two of which we actually visited, and we found that we paid the highest price by £10 pppn.
reviews.title: A Gem of A Place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled on business
reviews.text: Since coming home and re-reading the reviews which actually encouraged me to book, I feel something must have changed, although I really think adjectives such as "fantastic, elegant, marvellous, best in the area" were inaccurate in the first place.
reviews.title: A Nice Break

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: My wife and I have been coming up to Masham and staying at the Bank Villa for years now and greatly look forward to every trip. Graham and Liz always make us most welcome and as soon as we arrive, we feel relaxed and ready to unwind.
reviews.title: 2hrs and in another world

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of this beautifull B& B could not be bettered as they virtually are on the doorstep of 2 great well known brewery's which both serve terrific food. The village centre is a 2-3 minute walk away and you are in the heart of the yorkshire dales ready to be explored.
reviews.title: Beautiful place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breafast isalways a very enjoyable and satisfying way to start the day and normally keeps us going till the evening. Great choice and prepared lovely by Liz.
reviews.title: I don't like to be negative but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are already looking forward to our next stay here
reviews.title: Excellent in everyway!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Bank Villa for a couple of nights and found it to be a lovely place to stay in Masham. Very relaxing, beautifully decorated, clean and lovely food; especially the scrambled egg! Great service and a lovely place to stay while vising Masham and the surrounding area. We also had a great time visiting the Black Sheep Brewery!
reviews.title: Great accomodation, great location, great owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: After having stayed at Bank Villa a few times with my dad I felt it was time to write a review on it. Me and my dad travel together quite often to play golf and generally get away from the stresses of modern life (although as a student some might think i haven't yet experienced them!) and Bank Villa is far and away the best atmosphere we have come across. In no other establishment have we been welcomed so well, Bank Villa is truly where the PR talk of a family atmosphere actually exists.
reviews.title: The most welcoming atmosphere imaginable!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are always immaculate, and despite the many quirks of having a B&B in a listed building are always supurb. On the occasions where we have dined with the hosts the food has been outstanding, both perfectly cooked and in proper yorkshire portions. The sunday roast, especially, is a definite favourite of mine. Breakfast is always excellent, and all of our needs have been met, and more.
reviews.title: Perfect base for exploring a beautiful area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Many thanks to Liz and Graham for all the freindly banter over the years as well as the advice on places to visit and the day shooting Graham helped to organise. I would recommend Bank Villa as a must-visit B&B in north yorkshire, and am sure that my dad would heartily agree!
reviews.title: georgous, perfect B&B in lovely area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very pretty and perfectly situated guest house with welcoming owners who go out of their way to ensure you have a good stay.
reviews.title: Didn't want to leave.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had 2 nights at Bank Villa. Everything about it was perfect. Excellent hosts, scrumptous breakfasts and delightful bedroom . Liz and Graham were extremely friendly and made you feel very much at home in their lovely home.
reviews.title: FAB

description: The Yorkshire Dales is a beautiful and varied area to explore. To be found at the entrance to the small but beautifully formed market town of Masham, Bank Villa is in the most perfect location for you to enjoy all that is on offer. You may not need to drive anywhere! Which is a good thing with first class restaurants, pubs and both Black Sheep and Theakstons breweries on the door step!If you want to get out and about there are fantastic walks, cycle rides and drives from our door which will take you into the beauty and tranquility of the Dales.
